declarations.comments: type alias for a Nodes Name
declarations.title: Id

declarations.comments:
Dot-Node
```purescript run
> import Data.DotLang
> import Data.DotLang.Class (toText)
> import Data.DotLang.Attr.Node as Node
> toText $ Node "e" [Node.Margin 3, Node.label "some label"]
"e [margin=3, label=\"some label\"]"
```
declarations.title: Node

declarations.comments:
get a nodes id
```purescript run
> nodeId (Node "e" [Node.label "foo"])
"e"
```
declarations.title: nodeId

declarations.comments:
change Nodes id to a new one; keeing the old id as the label
```purescript run
> changeNodeId (_ <> "!") (Node "e" [])
(Node "e!" [(Label (TextLabel "e"))])
```
declarations.title: changeNodeId

declarations.comments:
egde from id to id
```purescript run
> toText $ Edge Forward "a" "b" []
"a -> b"
```
EdgeType determines the direction of the arrow
declarations.title: Edge

declarations.comments: definition in a graph
declarations.title: Definition

declarations.comments:
```purescript run
> import Data.DotLang.Attr.Global as Global
> :t global [Global.RankDir Global.FromLeft]
Definition
```

global as a part of a definition
declarations.title: global

declarations.comments:
```purescript run
> :t node "a" []
Definition
```
node as a part of a definition
declarations.title: node

declarations.comments:
```purescript run
> :t edge Forward "a" "b" [] 
Definition
```
edge as a part of a definition. 
`==>` and `=*>` can also be used for that purpose:
declarations.title: edge

declarations.comments:
```purescript run
> :t "a" ==> "b" 
Definition
```
Forward edge as as a definition

```purescript run
> import Data.DotLang.Attr.Edge as Edge
> import Color.Scheme.HTML (red)
> toText $ "a" =*> "b" $ [ Edge.FillColor red ]
"a -> b [fillcolor=\"#ff0000\"]; "
```
Forward edge with attributes as a definition

```purescript run
> :t "a" <== "b"
Definition
```
Backward edge as a definition

```purescript run
> :t "a" <*= "b" $ [ Edge.FillColor red ]
Definition
```
Backward edge with attributes as a definition

```purescript run
> toText $ "a" -==- "b"
"a -- b; "
```
Normal edge as definition

```purescript run
> toText $ "a" =*= "b" $ [ Edge.FillColor red ]
"a -- b [fillcolor=\"#ff0000\"]; "
```
Normal edge with attibutes
graph can either be a graph or digraph
declarations.title: Graph

declarations.comments:
create graph from Nodes and Edges
```purescript run
> :t graphFromElements [Node "e" [], Node "d" []] [ Edge Forward "e" "f" []]
Graph
```
declarations.title: graphFromElements

declarations.comments: `a` is a type that can be represented by a Dot-Graph
declarations.title: GraphRepr

declarations.comments:
```purescript run > import Data.DotLang.Attr.Edge > :t htmlLabel "
Label
" Attr ``` htmlLabel as a part of an attribute of an edge.
declarations.title: htmlLabel

declarations.comments:
```purescript run
> :t label "..." 
Attr
```
label as a part of an attribute of an edge.
declarations.title: label

declarations.comments:
Upper-case first character is major order;
lower-case second character is minor order.
declarations.title: PageDirValue

declarations.comments: possible node shapes
declarations.title: ShapeType

declarations.comments:
```purescript run > import Data.DotLang.Attr.Node > :t htmlLabel "
Label
" Attr ``` htmlLabel as a part of an attribute of a node.
declarations.title: htmlLabel

declarations.comments:
```purescript run
> import Data.DotLang.Attr.Node
> :t label "..." 
Attr
```
label as a part of an attribute of a node.
declarations.title: label

declarations.comments:
```purescript run
> import Data.DotLang
> import Data.DotLang.Class (toText)
> toText $ node "a" [recordLabel [subId "test" $ subLabel "c", subLabel "d", subRecord [ subLabel "k", subLabel "l"]]]
"a [label=\"{<test>c} | {d} | {{k} | {l}}\"]; "
```
declarations.title: recordLabel

declarations.comments: `a` is a type that has a representation in the dot language
declarations.title: DotLang
